name: Ai Ml
description: This theme covers how AI/ML is reshaping product strategy, development, and company operations—from building reliable AI features to designing agentic experiences and finding defensible distribution. Across episodes, guests address why AI products fail (non-determinism, evaluation gaps, weak iteration loops), how to operationalize learning (evals, post-training, experimentation), and what new moats and org designs matter as models commoditize and capabilities accelerate.
subtopics: AI product lifecycle shifts: non-determinism, iteration loops, and the agency/control trade-off
Evals and measurement: turning model behavior into testable requirements and a competitive advantage
Agents and tool use: moving from chat to proactive systems that execute workflows and use software/tools
Building moats in a fast-moving stack: differentiation beyond the base model (UX, data, evals, distribution, workflow integration)
Org design and operating cadence for AI: tighter cross-functional collaboration, AI ops, and faster experimentation
Pragmatic ML choices: when model/tooling decisions matter vs. when fundamentals (problem framing, data, evals, iteration) dominate
common_frameworks: Evals-first development (treat evals like PRDs; measure before/while you build)
Iterative deployment loops (ship small, observe, correct; step-by-step rollout for non-deterministic systems)
Agency vs. control trade-off (more autonomy increases capability and risk; requires guardrails and monitoring)
Post-training and continuous improvement loops (feedback, reward design, RL-style iteration to improve real workflows)
Human-in-the-loop + algorithmic judgment (combine automation with human review/escalation paths for reliability)
Experimentation as an operating system (high-velocity A/B testing and instrumentation, increasingly accelerated by AI tooling)
